critique: This document primarily concerns the delegation of presidential functions related to the International Sugar Agreement to the United States Trade Representative. It mandates consultation with the Secretary of Agriculture and the Secretary of State. Given the subject matter, the document has minimal impact on ideological tilt, immigration, executive power, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, social inclusion. The most relevant axis is economic regulation, where it has a slight interventionist leaning due to the nature of the International Sugar Agreement which involves trade regulations.
